New Records: Virat Kohli became the leading run scorer in the history of the T20 World Cup with his innings of 64 not out.
Key Match Events: India defeated Bangladesh by 5 runs in a rain-curtailed match.
Virat Kohli and KL Rahul scored sparkling fifties, with Kohli unbeaten on 64 and Rahul scoring 50.
Hasan Mahmud was the pick of the bowlers for Bangladesh with 3/47.
Arshdeep Singh contributed with 2/38 for India.
Liton Das top-scored for Bangladesh with a 27-ball 60.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was a must-win for India in the Super 12 Group 2 of the T20 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli was named Player of the Match for his outstanding performance.
The match was a pivotal moment in India's campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was rain-affected, reducing it to 16 overs after a brief interruption.
The result helped India stay at the top of the table.
